org.openimaj.video

Class ArrayBackedVideo<T extends Image<?,T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.video.Video<T>
      • org.openimaj.video.ArrayBackedVideo<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the image type of the frames
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<T>

    public class ArrayBackedVideo<T extends Image<?,T>>
extends Video<T>
    A video from an array of frames
    Author:
    Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk), David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      • ArrayBackedVideo

        public ArrayBackedVideo(T[] frames)
        Construct a video from the provided frames. Assumes a rate of 30 FPS.
        Parameters:
        frames - the frames

      • setCurrentFrameIndex

        public void setCurrentFrameIndex(long newFrame)
        Description copied from class: Video
        Set the current frame index (i.e. skips to a certain frame). If your video subclass can implement this in a cleverer way, then override this method, otherwise this method will simply grab frames until it gets to the given frame index. This method is naive and may take some time as each frame will be decoded by the video decoder.
        Overrides:
        setCurrentFrameIndex in class Video<T extends Image<?,T>>
        Parameters:
        newFrame - the new index
